intro: Polygonum littorale var. sitchense, commonly known as the Sichuan knotweed, is a variant of the common knotweed species native to China. It is a perennial herb characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink to red in color, blooming in late summer. It thrives in moist, sandy soils along riverbanks and wetlands. Due to its adaptability, it is often found in wetland ecosystems and is considered an important species for ecological studies.
